cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles SW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the southeastern Gulf, forecast to turn northeast and cross the Florida Panhandle on Wednesday, then accelerate northeastward across the southeastern U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Alabama–Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Watch from Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island FL and from the Alabama–Florida border to the MS–AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Pinar del Rio Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning for Isle of Youth Cuba and the coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, inland Southeast, and Mid-Atlantic coast from North Carolina to Delaware
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Thursday night into early Friday with a peak 11 % chance of sustained 34 kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge (1–2 ft) possible in Delaware Bay, but significant (>3 ft) surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches expected with isolated higher totals up to 6 inches, posing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents, brief river/urban flooding, potential for scattered downed trees and power outages
